result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Carl Geneman

defendant.name: Geneman, Michael Carl
defendant.address: 307 Park St, Apt 6, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Criminal case settlement

[Clerk: MK]
cases #13CF441, #14CF121 called at 3:30pm. 
Defendant Michael Carl Geneman in court with Attorney Brian Severson.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr. Geneman. Attorney Severson indicates that the Defense is aware that the State will request a PSI and that the State will have a motion regarding bond.
The charge and maximum penalties in Case #13CF441 are recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " No Contest " entered in Case #13CF441; factual basis stipulated (the victim is present); victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Geneman guilty in Case #13CF441, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #14CF121.

ADA Hall indicates that the State has its sentencing recommendation set forth on the Criminal Case Settlement form, however the State is also requesting a Presentence Investigation.  ADA Hall indicates that the State and the victim both feel that a pre-sentence report may be helpful to the Court in its sentencing considerations. 
The Court orders a long-form Presentence Investigation; the report is to be filed within sixty days. 
ADA Hall motions for the Court to revoke bond; arguments given by counsel. 
The Court revokes bond; Mr. Geneman will remain in the Jail until sentencing. 
The Court renews its disclosure that the Court has information regarding Mr. Geneman from its court-related involvement with him approximately nine years ago. 
Mr. Geneman indicates that he would like Judge Weston to be his sentencing-judge.  Counsel agree that this Court can proceed.
recess 3:51pm. 

NEXT:  (1) PSI Ordered in case #13CF441 (2) schedule case #13CF441 for Sentencing Hearing in approximately 75 days (JA- please set case #14CF121 for Review on the sentencing date, so that the file gets pulled for the hearing)
Plea hearing on September 2, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

[Clerk: MK]
cases #13CF441 and #14CF121 called at 9:10am. 
Defendant Michael C. Geneman in court with Attorney Brian Severson.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Severson anticipates a resolution of these cases; he seeks scheduling in 3 to 4 weeks to allow time to make a determination whether this will be a joint recommendation, an argued sentencing or a PSI-request.

Attorney Severson raises a concern regarding the Bond condition that prohibits unsupervised contact with minor children, in relation to the recent birth of his child with his wife Sara. 
The Court expresses its intent the that condition requiring supervised contact with children, including Mr. Geneman's infant son, remains. The Bond with its current conditions is workable for this, so the Bond will not be amended.
The Court verifies with Mr. Geneman's wife, Sara Geneman who is present in the courtroom, that she understands that Mr. Geneman is not to be alone with the child ever.    
Mr. Geneman makes a statement regarding his progress and intent to live a productive, law-abiding life.
Mr. Geneman verifies that the 307 Park Street, Apt. 6 address is current. 
recess 9:20am.

NEXT:  schedule Plea Hearing on both cases (allow one hour due to the possibility that the cases will proceed to sentencing that same day) in approximately thirty days
Status conference on July 29, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 25, 2014 at 09:40 am.

case called at 2:52pm. 
Defendant Michael Carl Geneman in court with Attorney Brian Severson.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Geneman waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
recess 2:55pm. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/25/14 at 9:40am (2) schedule Status Conference, along with Case #13CF441, approximately three weeks after the Pretrial date
Preliminary hearing on June 2, 2014 at 09:00 am.

case called at 8:30am. 
Defendant Michael Carl Geneman in court with Attorney Brian Severson.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This case was scheduled for Preliminary Hearing, however Mr. Geneman is ill and Attorney Severson expresses concerns about Mr. Geneman's ability to make decisions this morning about proceeding with the Preliminary Hearing.  
On request of the Defense, the Court adjourns.
Mr. Geneman indicates that his address remains the same.
recess 8:31am.  

NEXT:  reschedule Preliminary Hearing

Deputy present at security station informed the Clerk that Mr. Geneman was still waiting after submitting the Work/School release and indicated that he would like a Clerk to call him so he may be excused from his 8:30 am hearing due to illness. Clerk called Mr. Geneman and informed him that his release would be forwarded to the Court for review and that his appearance at 8:30 am was a mandatory appearance. If he did not appear, the Court may issue a warrant for his non-appearance or may excuse him due to information submitted and that the Clerk did not have authority to excuse him from the Court date. Clerk informed Mr. Geneman that he may want to inform his Attorney of the situation and offered to give him his attorney's contact information, as he didn't have it, but Mr. Geneman indicated he did not want the information and would just wait until his 8:30 am appearance.

Case called at 1:26 pm
Defendant Michael Carl Geneman in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney John R. Fiske. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Fiske informs the Court that he is appearing for bond purposes and that he is retiring in approximately one month.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint is correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1 & #2.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Kelly Price, Michael Brown, Kevin Zimmerman or Dalton Yeadon-Stark

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Court makes record that if Attorney Fiske retires before the case is resolved that Attorney Fiske notify Branch 1 so that a coloquy can be conducted with Mr. Geneman on his right to counsel.

Recess: 1:35 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 4/23/14 at 10:20 am
Preliminary Hearing: to be set
